cyclone.name: ARTHUR
cyclone.current_location: about 210 miles SSW of Cape Hatteras, North Carolina
cyclone.trajectory: moving north-northeast, then turning northeast parallel to the North Carolina coast and curving eastward away from the U.S. Mid-Atlantic
cyclone.expected_landfall_location: near or just east of Cape Hatteras, NC (Outer Banks – possible brush rather than a true landfall)

weather_observation.warning_coast: Tropical Storm Warning from Surf City to Duck NC, including Pamlico and Albemarle Sounds
weather_observation.impacted_coast: Southeast and Mid-Atlantic U.S. coast from Georgia through Virginia
weather_observation.wind: Brief tropical-storm-force gusts (30–40 mph) possible Monday evening into early Tuesday, but overall probability very low (≤3%).
weather_observation.storm_surge: Minor coastal flooding and elevated surf/rip currents possible, surge heights generally below 3 ft.
weather_observation.rainfall: Scattered rainbands Monday–Tuesday, totals generally 0.5–2 inches near the port.
weather_observation.other_hazards: High surf and dangerous rip currents affecting port entrance channels.
